00021     : optimalThreshold_(0), backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_(255),
00022     noiseRemovalTime_(0.0), optimalThresholdComputingTime_(0.0), backgroundReferenceGrayLevelFindingTime_(0.0)

00041 unsigned char Preprocessor::computeOptimalThreshold (const Clip &clip)
00042 {
00043     // Find background reference gray level
00044     findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel(clip);
00045     optimalThreshold_ = backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00046     unsigned char temporaryThreshold;
00047     
00048     do
00049     {
00050         // Compute the background and objects mean values
00051         unsigned int backgroundMeanValue = 0, objectsMeanValue = 0;
00052         unsigned int nSamples = 0;
00053         
00054         for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00055         {
00056             for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00057             {
00058                 // Get gray level of this pixel
00059                 unsigned char grayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(i,j);
00060                 
00061                 // Assume light gray values as the background
00062                 if ( grayLevel >= optimalThreshold_ )
00063                 {
00064                     backgroundMeanValue += grayLevel;
00065                     nSamples++;
00066                 }
00067                 else
00068                     objectsMeanValue += grayLevel;
00069             }
00070         }
00071         backgroundMeanValue = round(backgroundMeanValue / nSamples);
00072         objectsMeanValue = round(objectsMeanValue / (clip.nPixels() - nSamples));
00073                 
00074         // Update the optimal threshold keeping the last one
00075         temporaryThreshold = optimalThreshold_;
00076         optimalThreshold_ = round((objectsMeanValue + backgroundMeanValue) / 2);
00077     }
00078     while (temporaryThreshold != optimalThreshold_);
00079 
00080     return optimalThreshold_;
00081 };

00097 unsigned char Preprocessor::findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel (const Clip &clip, const unsigned int &referenceGrayLevelNeighbours)
00098 {
00099     // Compute clip histogram
00100     std::vector<unsigned int> histogram(256, 0);
00101     
00102     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00103     {
00104         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00105         {
00106             // Get gray level of this pixel
00107             unsigned char grayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(i,j);
00108             
00109             // Update histogram
00110             histogram[grayLevel] += 1;
00111         }
00112     }
00113     
00114     
00115     // Search the more frequent level of gray
00116     std::vector<unsigned int>::iterator histogramIterator;
00117     unsigned char moreFrequentGrayLevel = 0, levelCounter = 0;
00118     
00119     for (histogramIterator = histogram.begin(); histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end(); ++histogramIterator, ++levelCounter)
00120     {
00121         if ( *histogramIterator > histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel] )
00122             moreFrequentGrayLevel = levelCounter;
00123     }
00124     unsigned int referenceGrayLevel = moreFrequentGrayLevel * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00125     
00126     
00127     // Search the neighbours of the more frequent level of gray
00128     std::vector<unsigned int>::reverse_iterator histogramReverseIterator( std::find (histogram.rbegin(), histogram.rend(), histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel])++ );
00129     histogramIterator = histogramReverseIterator.base()++;
00130     unsigned int nFrequencies = histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00131     
00132     for ( unsigned int i = 1; i <= referenceGrayLevelNeighbours; ++i )
00133     {
00134         // Search forwards
00135         if ( histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end() )
00136         {
00137             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel + i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00138             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00139 
00140             ++histogramIterator;
00141         }
00142         
00143         // Search backwards
00144         if ( histogramReverseIterator not_eq histogram.rend() )
00145         {
00146             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel - i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00147             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00148             
00149             ++histogramReverseIterator;
00150         }
00151     }
00152     
00153     
00154     // Set the background reference gray level found
00155     backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = round(referenceGrayLevel / nFrequencies);
00156     return backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00157 };

00175 void Preprocessor::removeIsolatedNoise (Clip &clip, const unsigned int &isolationCoefficient)
00176 {
00177     // Find background reference gray level
00178     findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel(clip);
00179     
00180     
00181     // Loop over the clip to remove every noisy isolated pixel
00182     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00183     {
00184         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00185         {
00186             unsigned int nBackgroundPixels = 0, nPixels = 0;
00187 
00188             // Explore the pixel neighbourhood
00189             for(int p = i-1; p < static_cast<int>(i+2); p++)
00190             {
00191                 for(int q = j-1; q < static_cast<int>(j+2); q++)
00192                 {
00193                     // Check clip borders
00194                     if ( (p < 0) or (p >= static_cast<int>(clip.height())) )
00195                         continue;
00196                     
00197                     if ( (q < 0) or (q >= static_cast<int>(clip.width())) )
00198                         continue;
00199                     
00200                     nPixels++;
00201                     
00202                     // Get neighbour pixel gray level
00203                     unsigned char neighbourPixelGrayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(p, q);
00204                     
00205                     // When background gray level is close to white but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00206                     if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ > optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel > optimalThreshold_) )
00207                         nBackgroundPixels++;
00208                     else
00209                     {
00210                         // When background gray level is close to black but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00211                         if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel < optimalThreshold_) )
00212                             nBackgroundPixels++;
00213                     }
00214                 }
00215             }
00216             
00217             // Adjust the isolated coefficient influence according to the number of neighbours found
00218             unsigned int realIsolationCoefficient = nPixels - 8 + (8 - isolationCoefficient);
00219 
00220             // Delete the noisy pixel if it is isolated
00221             if (nBackgroundPixels >= realIsolationCoefficient)
00222                 clip.setPixelGrayLevel(i, j, backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00223         }
00224     }
00225 };

00229 //
00230 // Otsu's algorithm for computing optimal threshold
00231 //
00232 
00233 // // Compute image histogram
00234 // std::vector<double> histogram(256, 0.0);
00235 // for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00236 // {
00237 //  for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00238 //  {
00239 //      // Get gray level of this pixel
00240 //      double grayLevel = clip.getPixel(i,j).grayLevel();
00241 //      
00242 //      // Update histogram
00243 //      histogram[std::floor(grayLevel * 255.0)] += 1.0;
00244 //  }
00245 // }
00246 // 
00247 // // Normalise histogram
00248 // std::transform( histogram.begin(), histogram.end(), histogram.begin(), std::bind1st(std::multiplies<double>(), 1.0 / static_cast<double>(clip.nPixels())) );
00249 // 
00250 // // Compute the zero- and first-order cumulative moments of the normalised histogram up to the kth level
00251 // std::vector<double> zeroMoments(256, 0.0), firstMoments(256, 0.0);
00252 // for ( unsigned int level = 0; level < 256; ++level )
00253 // {
00254 //  for ( unsigned int i = 1; i <= (level+1); ++i )
00255 //  {
00256 //      zeroMoments[level]  += histogram[i-1];
00257 //      firstMoments[level] += histogram[i-1] * i;
00258 //  }
00259 // }
00260 // 
00261 // // Compute the total mean level of the image
00262 // double meanLevel = 0.0;
00263 // for ( unsigned int level = 1; level <= 256; ++level )
00264 //  meanLevel += histogram[level-1] * level;
00265 // 
00266 // // Compute the variance of the class separability at every gray level    
00267 // std::vector<double> variance(256, 0.0);
00268 // for ( unsigned int level = 0; level < 256; ++level )
00269 //  variance[level] = pow((meanLevel * zeroMoments[level]) - firstMoments[level], 2) / (zeroMoments[level] * (1 - zeroMoments[level]));
00270 //  
00271 // // Find the maximum value of variance
00272 // unsigned int level = 0;
00273 // double maxVariance = variance[0];
00274 // for ( std::vector<double>::iterator varianceIterator = variance.begin(); varianceIterator < variance.end(); ++varianceIterator, ++level )
00275 // {
00276 //  if ( *varianceIterator > maxVariance )
00277 //  {
00278 //      maxVariance = *varianceIterator;
00279 //      optimalThreshold_ = level;
00280 //  }
00281 // }
00282 // optimalThreshold_ = optimalThreshold_ / 255.0;
00283 // 
00284 // std::cout << "Optimal threshold with Otsu's method: " << optimalThreshold_ << std::endl;
